title: Kahkakiw's Straight Talk on Coronavirus - With Special Guest Niki Ashton
description: Did you know that Ravens belong to the Corvid Family? In this episode Kahkakiw the Raven chats with Niki Ahston, MP for Churchill–Keewatinook Aski district.  With a spin on words, Kahkakiw and Ashton share a special message for northerners, and play a bird identification game called "CORVID 2020".  Join in the fun in this humourous and meaningful video. * All political parties have been invited to participate in the Kahkakiw series. If you missed the invite, please reach out to info@covid19indigenous.ca

title: Kahkakiw's Straight Talk on Elders
description: The weather is warm, and the landscape is blooming with new life. We all want to get outside and visit friends and familly. Kahkakiw reminds us to remain vigilent and to think of our Elders, and to take actions to keep them safe.

title: Kahkakiw Straight Talk: Kids and Coronavirus
description: Kahkakiw is wondering where everyone went, and especially all the kids! A search in a parking lot and online is where he found them. Kahkakiw shows them that he cares and offers words of encouragement.

title: Kahkakiw on CBC Winnipeg
description: Kahkakiw got the attention of the CBC News Winnipeg! This piece explores why it is important to send culturally appropriate announcements during a pandemic. Phyllis Hart helped to translate the Cree subtitles. News Anchor Janet Stewart called Kahkakiw a wise crow. He is a Raven, and is deeply insulted (jk!)

title: Kahkakiw's Straight Talk on Social Distancing
description: With Easter celebrations quickly approaching, the safest way to celebrate with family is by video chat, call or text. Kahkakiw reminds us to look out for one another. Even if you feel good and healthy, you could still pass on coronavirus to your family or friends if you meet for the holiday, or you could catch it from someone else.

title: Kahkakiw's Straight Talk on the Coronavirus (COVID-19)
description: Kahkakiw delivers a Cree-language public service announcement to keep yourself and others safe in the time of coronavirus. Please share with your relations and remind them, "when you hear the raven's call, remember to wash your hands!"

title: Community Interview with Denise Cole
description: Check out our interview with Denise Cole, an Inuk two spirit land protector from from Happy Valley Goose Bay. We talk about some of the challenges and impacts of COVID-19 in Denise’s community, and how they are using this time to come up with new ways to do their work around community and land protection.

title: Highlights from A Conversation on Indigenous Food Sovereignty
description: Have you seen our shortened version of the full length food sovereignty webinar? It highlights some of the key points and moments from the webinar, including the importance of dismantling structural racism in the food system, how Covid-19 speaks to the inequities of our broken food system, and how intertwined the social and environmental implications of food are for Indigenous peoples.

title: Dave Scott of Swan Lake First Nation: COVID-Community Extended Interview
description: Dave Scott, an Elder and Policy Advisor from Swan Lake First Nation shares his experience with us, from the community health centre. From ceremonies and traditions, social distancing, and people returning to the community, Dave discusses how Covid-19 is impacting his community.

title: Son, I didn't know that - COVID Community Updates
description: Ron: "Well, one of the things that the Navajo kind of put a title to the Coronavirus is, it's called the (spoken in Navajo), a pneumonia type or a big cough. It doesn't really translate it as a dangerous virus. An elderly Navajo would just think, Oh, you know, it's just, it's just a big flu going around. This is what I was telling the elderly yesterday, that this kind of like pneumonia but to the extreme, and she just she just simply said 'Son, I didn't know that. Now I know.'" Ron's story reminds us to reach out to friends and family who may not know the deadly seriousness of the novel coronavirus COVID-19.
